New Records: Belgium have not drawn a match at the European Championship since a 0-0 stalemate against Italy at the 1980 tournament, all of 19 games ago.
Key Match Events: K. De Bruyne scored in the 80' minute
Lukaku had a goal chalked off for the third time in two games
Pre-Game Insights: Romania's Iordanescu added: 'In terms of challenges, this was the highest level. We had a great start to the tournament, now let's see how we deal with difficulty.'
Post-Match Reflections: Domenico Tedesco: 'I'm very relieved that we won the game, it was very important to get that three points and of course we missed some chances.'
Romania boss Edward Iordanescu, speaking after the match, said: 'You saw a team with lots of quality: they have speed, they have explosion, power.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: It is the first time that all four teams in a single group are on equal points after two match weeks in European Championship history.
Others: KDB was named man-of-the-match by UEFA
Casteels impresses in goal for Belgium
Form is temporary, class is permanent, Kevin De Bruyne came in for some criticism after the shock defeat to Slovakia in the opening game.
